artist: Artist: Tsukioka Yoshitoshi; Author: Nozaki Bunzō; Publisher: Daikokuya Kinnosuke
catalogue_raissonne: Keyes, Courage and Silence (1982), no. 134.15; Iwakiri, Yoshitoshi (2014), p. 288.
creditline: The Mary Griggs Burke Endowment Fund established by the Mary Livingston Griggs and Mary Griggs Burke Foundation, gifts of various donors, by exchange, and gift of Edmond Freis in memory of his parents, Rose and Leon Freis
description: standing man with his legs wide apart, wearing high yellow and brown zori sandals and blue garments with predominately blue, green and yellow floral medallions on skirt, holding a brown and yellow umbrella over which a black and grey shadowy demon peers
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From One Hundred Tales from Japan and China (Wakan hyaku monogatari 和漢百物語)
signed: 一魁斎芳年画 {Ikkaisai Yoshitoshi ga}
title: Fuwa Bansaku
